page.title: 17SHIPPING
page.content: The channel of the Colne Estuary is very narrow and shallow making it unsuitable for large ships without dredging.Small cargo boats carry:wood, coke,coal,fertilizer and animal food. These ships arrive from West Africa, Scandinavia,Russia,and South America. The channel is also used by Pilot boats,coastguards,cutters,and police launches.Sailing barges used to be common in the estuary,but are now ornamental and occasionally used in barge races. A wide variety of leisure craft use the waterway-canoes,dinghies, catamarans,sloops and ketches.Wind surfing and water-skiing are increasingly popular.Regattas are held regularly through out the Summer.A feature of special importance is the barge race from Brightlingsea to Maldon.
